author: rooneg
msg: Fix issue #2442, verbose list broken with peg revisions over ra_dav.
It turns out that the underlying issue here is a difference in the way
that svn_ra_get_locks worked in ra_dav versus the other ra layers.  In
both ra_local and ra_svn it's perfectly valid to give svn_ra_get_locks
a nonexistent path, it'll just return no locks for it, but ra_dav says
that's an error and returns path not found.
Since this does seem to cause a problem in a reasonable case, I've made
ra_dav act like the other RA layers, and just return no locks in that
situation.  Because this is kind of strange behavior compared to other
commands, I've noted it in the doxygen comments for svn_ra_get_locks.
(svn_ra_get_locks): Note behavior when path refers to a nonexistent
(svn_ra_dav__get_locks): Don't return an error when the path doesn't

author: brane
msg: Begin refactoring the BDB FS back-end in preparation for implementing
a cache of open BDB environment handles.
Incidentally, set the DB_AUTO_COMMIT property on the opened database
environmentand remove other (now-redundant) uses of this flag.
(SVN_BDB_VERSION_AT_LEAST): New; compile-time check for the BDB version.
Replace all explicit BDB version checks with this macro.
(SVN_BDB_PATH_UTF8): New predicate. True if BDB expects paths to be
(open_databases): New function. Factor out common code from
Replace all calls to DB_ENV->open() and DB_ENV->close() with
instead of lists of BDB flags.
Remove uses of SVN_BDB_AUTO_COMMIT; svn_fs_bdb__open_env() sets
this flag for the whole environment, and that affects all
